text: HB1 H.R.1 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act - Today, US House Judiciary Committee Member Ted W. Lieu (D Los Angeles County) joined Ranking Member Jerrold Nadler (D NY) in leading more than 190 House Democrats in introducing the Keep Families Together Act, legislation that will end family separation at the U.S. border. In addition to Reps. Lieu and Nadler, original House cosponsors of the legislation include: Subcommittee on Immigration Ranking Member Zoe Lofgren (D CA), Rep. Luis Gutierrez (D IL), Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D WA), Rep. Jimmy Panetta (D CA) and House Democratic leadership. This legislation is the House companion to the legislation introduced by Senate Judiciary Committee Ranking Member Dianne Feinstein (D CA) earlier this month. 5 U.S.C. 552(a)(1)(E)
